timeline.author: bantonsson

timeline.bodyText: So this no longer matches up to the comment on the line above it. We cache UTF8BytesStringin a WeakMap in datadog.trace.instrumentation.jdbc.JDBCMaps, and as far as I can tell from running some experiments, only the key is treated as a weak reference, and if we don't make a copy String here, nothing will ever be removed from that map.
timeline.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText: Sorry this was an automated refactor suggested by IDEA, I'll roll it back.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: Do you mean the private constructor? The other create method hopefully does the right thing by calling this method for String.
replies.author: bantonsson

timeline.bodyText: I'm a bit afraid that we might leak things here if this gets used from the wrong place. Should there be a more ominous name for creating a UTF8BytesString that is allocated this way?
timeline.author: bantonsson

replies.bodyText: Yes, we could, my intention was that we would use this lots for constants, or things we cache because we think they're effectively constant. In the comparatively rare case that we put something unusual in trace, we'd just use String
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: Two separate methods calling in to different constructors might be a good idea indeed
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: Addressed this, there's now a createConstant which copies the bytes into a "page". If we can move all constants over to using CharSequences I will use it to store them, and allocate constants at instrumentation load time, and remove the centralised "string table". This should eliminate a large number fo hash map lookups.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: Great. Removing the hash lookups is exactly where I was hoping that we'd end up!
replies.author: bantonsson
